title: Ghiya Mtairek
text:
Ghiya Mohamad Mtairek (; born 9 January 2000) is a Lebanese <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> for Lebanese club <a href="Super%20Girls%20FC">Super Girls</a> and the <a href="Lebanon%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Lebanon national team</a>. Mtairek is also a <a href="Long-distance%20running">long-distance runner</a>.
Football career.
Mtairek played for <a href="Terdeba%20Stars">Terdeba Stars</a> in the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Lebanese%20Women%27s%20Football%20League">2018–19 season</a>, scoring four goals. She remained at the club during the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Lebanese%20Women%27s%20Football%20League">2019–20 season</a>, when they changed their name to Southern Stars; she scored 16 goals. On 1 July 2020, Mtairek joined <a href="Super%20Girls%20FC">Super Girls</a>.
Mtairek made her senior international debut for <a href="Lebanon%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Lebanon</a> on 8 April 2021, coming on as a substitute in a <a href="2021%20Armenia%20Women%27s%20International%20Friendly%20Tournament">friendly tournament</a> against <a href="Armenia%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Armenia</a>.
Running career.
Mtairek is also a <a href="Long-distance%20running">long-distance runner</a>. She began running aged 9, at the <a href="Beirut%20Marathon">Beirut Marathon</a>, where she won the <a href="5000%20metres">5 km race</a> of her age group. Mtairek participated in all Lebanese championships of her respective age group from 2009 to 2019.
In 2016 Mtairek, who was part of Phoenicia Club Tyre, participated with the Lebanese national team at the 2016 <a href="West%20Asian%20Athletics%20Championships">West Asian Junior Athletics Championships</a> in <a href="Bahrain">Bahrain</a>, finishing in fourth place in the <a href="400%20metres">400 m</a> women. She participated in the 2017 <a href="Limassol%20Marathon">Limassol Marathon</a>, finishing second in her category and fifth overall in the female 5 km race. Mtairek also participated the following year, finishing third in the female 5 km.
In 2018 Mtairek took part in the Ooredoo Marathon in <a href="Qatar">Qatar</a>, finishing second in the 5 km. In 2019, she won the Lebanese Universities Cross Country representing the Islamic University of Lebanon (IUL). Mtairek finished in second place in the 2019 Limassol Marathon female 5 km.
